description: The Electric Schedule E-TOU-C is a residential time-of-use (peak pricing 4 - 9 p.m. every day) rate plan. The rate plan is available to residential customers on an opt-in basis and is applicable to single-phase and polyphase residential service in single-family dwellings, flats, and apartments separately metered by PG&E. It also applies to single-phase and polyphase service in common areas in multifamily complexes and to all single-phase and polyphase farm service on the premises operated by the person whose residence is supplied through the same meter. The rate schedule applies everywhere PG&E provides electric service.

electricity_costs.explanation: The kWh costs for each period are based on the E-TOU-C TOTAL BUNDLED RATES section of the text, which provides the Total Energy Rates and Baseline Credit for both Peak and Off-Peak periods during Summer and Winter seasons.

usage.explanation: The JSON file represents the usage limits for each region and season, categorized by usage type (Basic Quantities and All-Electric Quantities). The values are in kilowatt-hours (kWh) per day.

fixed_costs.explanation: The minimum cost mentioned in the text is the 'Delivery Minimum Bill Amount,' which is $0.39167 per meter per day. This minimum charge is applied to the delivery portion of the bill, which includes all rate components other than the generation rate.
